snippet: On the 100th anniversary of the discovery of cosmic radiation by the physicist Victor F. Hess, he is remembered by his grandson.
abstract: Bill Breisky essay recounts his memories of his grandfather, Victor Francis Hess, who discovered the existence of cosmic rays a century ago, winning the 1936 Nobel Prize in Physics for his efforts.
lead_paragraph: On the 100th anniversary of the discovery of cosmic radiation by the physicist Victor F. Hess, he is remembered by his grandson.

headline.seo: When Victor Hess Discovered Cosmic Rays in a Hydrogen Balloon
headline.main: On Its Centenary, Celebrating a Ride That Advanced Physics
